chapter.p: 1And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,Literally “to say” 2“Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying,Literally “to say” ‘Thus says Yahweh,

ul.li1: “I remember concerning you the loyal love of your childhood,Or “youth”
ul.li2: the love of your betrothal-time,
ul.li1: your goingOr “walking” after me in the desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li2: in the land not sown.
ul.li1: 3Israel was holy to Yahweh,
ul.li2: the first fruit of his produce.
ul.li1: All those who ate it were held guilty;
ul.li2: disaster came to them,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.’ ”

chapter.p: 4Hear the word of Yahweh, O house of Jacob, and all the clansOr “families” of the house of Israel. 5Thus says Yahweh:

ul.li1: “What injustice did your ancestorsOr “fathers” find in me
ul.li2: that they were far from me,
ul.li1: and they went after the vanity,
ul.li2: and they became vain?
ul.li1: 6And they did not say,
ul.li2: ‘Where is Yahweh,
ul.li1: the one who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
ul.li2: the one who led us in the desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li1: in a land of desert plains and gorges,Hebrew “gorge”
ul.li2: in a land of dryness and deep darkness,
ul.li1: in a land that no one passes through,Literally “no man passes through in it”
ul.li2: and no human lives there?’
ul.li1: 7And I brought you to the land of the orchard,
ul.li2: to eat its fruit, and its good things.Hebrew “good thing”
ul.li1: But you entered and defiled my land,
ul.li2: and my inheritance you made a detestable thing.Or “abomination”
ul.li1: 8The priests did not say, ‘Where is Yahweh?’
ul.li2: and those who handle the law did not know me,
ul.li1: and the shepherds have rebelled against me,Literally “broken with me”
ul.li2: and the prophets prophesied by Baal,
ul.li1: and they went after things which do not profit.
9ThereforeLiterally “To thus” I again bring a lawsuit against you,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “and with your childrenLiterally “sons of your sons” I bring a lawsuit.
ul.li1: 10For go over to the coasts of Cyprus and look,
ul.li2: and send to Kedar and consider very closely,
and see if there has been a thing like this:
ul.li1: 11Has a nation exchanged gods? And they are not gods!
ul.li2: But my people have exchanged their glory for that which does not profit.
ul.li1: 12Be appalled, O heavens, at this, and shudder;
ul.li2: be utterly desolate,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 13“For my people have committed two evils:
ul.li2: they have forsaken me, the sourceOr “fountain” of living water,
to hew out for themselves cisterns, cracked cisterns that can hold no water.
ul.li1: 14Is Israel a slave? Or a slave born in a house?Literally “born of a house”
ul.li2: Why has he become plunder?
ul.li1: 15The young lions have roared against him,
ul.li2: they have raisedLiterally “given” their voices.Hebrew “voice”
ul.li1: And they have made his land as horror;
ul.li2: his cities are destroyed, withoutLiterally “from not” an inhabitant.
ul.li1: 16Moreover, people of Memphis and Tahpanhes
ul.li2: will shaveLiterally “pasture” your skull.Or “crown of your head”
ul.li1: 17Did you not do this to yourself,
ul.li2: by forsaking Yahweh, your God,
at the time of your leading in the way?
ul.li1: 18And now why do you goLiterally “what for you” the way of Egypt
ul.li2: to drink the waters of the Shihor?
ul.li1: And why do you goLiterally “what for you” the way of Assyria
ul.li2: to drink the waters of the Euphrates?Literally “river”
ul.li1: 19Your wickedness will chastise you,
ul.li2: and your apostasies will reprove you.
ul.li1: Therefore know and see that it is evil and bitter,
ul.li2: your forsaking of Yahweh, your God,
ul.li1: and fear of me is not in you,”
ul.li2: declaresLiterally “a declaration of” the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.
ul.li1: 20“For from long ago you have broken your yoke,
ul.li2: you tore to pieces your bonds.
ul.li1: And you said, ‘I will not serve!’
ul.li2: But on every high hill and under every leafy tree
you were lying down as a prostitute.
ul.li1: 21Yet I planted you as a choice vine,
ul.li2: all of it a seed of trustworthiness.
ul.li1: How then have you altered before me
ul.li2: into something that is degenerate, the foreign vine?
ul.li1: 22For if you wash with natron,
ul.li2: and you use much soap,Literally “make numerous for yourself alkaline salt”
ul.li1: your guilt is sticking as a stain beforeLiterally “to the face of” me,”
ul.li2: declaresLiterally “a declaration of” the Lord Yahweh.
ul.li1: 23“How can you say, ‘I have not defiled myself,
ul.li2: I have not gone after the Baals?’
ul.li1: Look at your way in the valley,
ul.li2: know what you have done.
ul.li1: You are a young she-camel,
ul.li2: interweaving her ways.
ul.li1: 24A wild ass accustomed to the desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li2: in the desire of her soul.
ul.li1: She gasps for wind in her rutting time.
ul.li2: Who can quellOr “restrain” her lust?
ul.li1: All those who seek her will not grow weary,
ul.li2: in her month they will find her.
ul.li1: 25Restrain your foot from being barefoot,
ul.li2: and your throat from thirst.
ul.li1: But you said, ‘It is hopeless.
ul.li2: No! For I have loved strangers,
and after them I will go.’Or “walk”
ul.li1: 26As the shame of a thief when he is caught in the act,
ul.li2: so the house of Israel will be ashamed.
ul.li1: They, their kings, their officials,
ul.li2: and their priests, and their prophets.
ul.li1: 27Those who say to the tree, ‘You are my father,’
ul.li2: and to the stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’
ul.li1: For they have turned their backsLiterally “neck” to me, and not their faces.
ul.li2: But in the time of their trouble they say, ‘Arise and save us.’
ul.li1: 28But where are your gods that you made for yourself?
ul.li2: Let them arise if they can save you in the time of your trouble.
ul.li1: For according to the number of your towns
ul.li2: are your gods, O Judah.
ul.li1: 29Why do you complain to me?
ul.li2: All of you have rebelled against me,”Literally “broken with me” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 30“For in vainLiterally “the vanity” I have struck your children.
ul.li2: They accepted no discipline.
ul.li1: Your sword devoured your prophets,
ul.li2: like a raveningOr “destroying” lion.
ul.li1: 31O generation, you see the word of Yahweh.
ul.li2: Have I been a desertOr “wilderness” to Israel? Or a land of great darkness?
ul.li1: Why do my people say, ‘We roam about freely,
ul.li2: we will not come again to you’?
ul.li1: 32Can a young woman forget her ornaments?Or “jewelry” Or a bride her sashes?
ul.li2: Yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
ul.li1: 33How well you do on your way to seek love!
ul.li2: ThereforeLiterally “To thus” even to the wicked woman you can teach your ways.
ul.li1: 34Also on your skirts is found
ul.li2: the blood of the life of the innocent, the poor.
ul.li1: You did not find them in the act of breaking into a house.
ul.li2: But in spite of all these things,
ul.li1: 35yet you say, ‘But I am innocent,
ul.li2: surely his anger has turned away from me.’
ul.li1: Look, I am entering into judgment with you
ul.li2: because of your saying, ‘I have not sinned.’
ul.li1: 36How you go about so much changing your way!
ul.li2: Also by Egypt you will be put to shame,
just as you were put to shame by Assyria.
ul.li1: 37Also from there you will come out
ul.li2: with your hands on your head,
ul.li1: for Yahweh has rejected those in whom you trust,Literally “in your objects of trust”
ul.li2: and you will not prosper through them.
